content:
I believe a new site on category theory just came online. Kerodan.net "an online resource for homotopy-coherent mathematics".

Kerodon is an online textbook on categorical homotopy theory and related mathematics. It currently consists of a handful of chapters, but should grow (slowly) over time. It is modeled on the Stacks project, and is maintained by Jacob Lurie.
As you can see, it's not actually particularly new. It's quite nice though.

What a cute mascot!

It makes the homepage look like a math book for children and then .... "Chapter 1: The language of ∞\infty∞-categories".

The world would be a better place if there were more math books like that :smile:
This is Luries HTT in webpage form. Though I think there are a number of new things and different presentations
